issue.title: (forward_)list specialized remove algorithms are over constrained

discussion.p: The signatures of forwardlist::remove and list::remove defined in before 11 + before 15:

blockquote.pre: requires EqualityComparable<T> void remove(const T& value);

discussion.p: are asymmetric to their predicate variants (which only require Predicate, not EquivalenceRelation) and with the free algorithm remove (which only require HasEqualTo). Also, nothing in the pre-concept WP N2723 implies that EqualityComparable should be the intended requirement.

blockquote.p: We agree with the proposed resolution, but would like additional input from concepts experts.

Current rationale and wording for this issue is built around concepts. I suggest the issue reverts to Open status. I believe there is enough of an issue to review after concepts are removed from the WP to re-examine the issue in Santa Cruz, rather than resolve as NAD Concepts.

Recommend NAD: The concept-free wording as of N2960 has no longer the over-specified requirement EqualityComparable for the remove function that uses ==. In fact, now the same test conditions exists as for the free algorithm remove (). The error was introduced in the process of conceptifying.
NAD, solved by the removal of concepts.

li.p: Replace in before 11 and in before 15

blockquote.pre: requires EqualityComparable<T> HasEqualTo<T, T> void remove(const T& value);
